snippet: If rates rise, bondholders’ old bonds will lose value. If rates fall, their old bonds may be redeemed by the company, depriving the bondholders of yield.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column says that if interest rates rise, bondholders’ old bonds will lose value, but if rates fall, their old bonds may be redeemed by the company, depriving the bondholders of yield.
lead_paragraph: If rates rise, bondholders’ old bonds will lose value. If rates fall, their old bonds may be redeemed by the company, depriving the bondholders of yield.

headline.print_headline: Risk Creeps Up in Long-Term Bonds
headline.seo: Risk Creeps Up in Long-Term Bonds
headline.main: Risk Creeps Up in Long-Term Bonds
